item.title: Melissa add a quote by Germaine Greer
item.description: "A library is a place where you can lose your innocence without losing your virginity." -- Germaine Greer

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Peter S. Jennison
item.description: "Children deprived of words become school dropouts; dropouts deprived of hope behave delinquently. Amateur censors blame delinquency on reading immoral books and magazines, when in fact, the inability to read anything is the basic trouble." -- Peter S. Jennison

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Books should go where they will be most appreciated, and not sit unread, gathering dust on a forgotten shelf, don't you agree?" -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Henry Ward Beecher
item.description: "Books are not made for furniture, but there is nothing else that so beautifully furnishes a house." -- Henry Ward Beecher

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Napoleon Bonaparte
item.description: "Show me a family of readers, and I will show you the people who move the world." -- Napoleon Bonaparte

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "[D]on't ever apologize to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for. Use your library). Don't apologize to this author for buying books second hand, or getting them from bookcrossing or borrowing a friend's copy. What's important to me is that people read the books and enjoy them, and that, at some point in there, the book was bought by someone. And that people who like things, tell other people. The most important thing is that people read... " -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Melissa add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Eating and reading are two pleasures that combine admirably." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "When I got [my] library card, that was when my life began." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "All morning I struggled with the sensation of stray wisps of one world seeping through the cracks of another. Do you know the feeling when you start reading a new book before the membrane of the last one has had time to close behind you? You leave the previous book with ideas and themes -- characters even -- caught in the fibers of your clothes, and when you open the new book, they are still with you." -- Diane Setterfield

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "The world was a terrible place, cruel, pitiless, dark as a bad dream. Not a good place to live. Only in books could you find pity, comfort, happiness - and love. Books loved anyone who opened them, they gave you security and friendship and didn't ask anything in return; they never went away, never, not even when you treated them badly." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Books are for people who wish they were somewhere else." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Melissa add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I can't imagine a man really enjoying a book and reading it only once." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "The world was hers for the reading." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Melissa add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Melissa add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Melissa add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "You get a little moody sometimes but I think that's because you like to read. People that like to read are always a little fucked up." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Melissa add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Isn't it odd how much fatter a book gets when you've read it several times?" Mo had said..."As if something were left between the pages every time you read it. Feelings, thoughts, sounds, smells...and then, when you look at the book again many years later, you find yourself there, too, a slightly younger self, slightly different, as if the book had preserved you like a pressed flower...both strange and familiar." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Anne Herbert
item.description: "Libraries will get you through times of no money better than money will get you through times of no libraries." -- Anne Herbert

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "That's what I love about reading: one tiny thing will interest you in a book, and that tiny thing will lead you to another book, and another bit there will lead you onto a third book. It's geometrically progressive - all with no end in sight, and for no other reason than sheer enjoyment." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Patricia A. McKillip
item.description: "The odd thing about people who had many books was how they always wanted more." -- Patricia A. McKillip
